channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Les Copilot+ PC sont un peu plus joueurs
item.description: Les PC fonctionnant avec Windows sur Arm ont plein de qualités, mais ça galère toujours pour les jeux vidéo. Qualcomm et Microsoft améliorent tout de même les choses, à coups de nouveaux pilotes, d'optimisations et d’un support élargi pour certains jeux populaires.

item.title: Pokémon Legends: Z-A - Mega Dimension DLC will add Mega Zeraora, but Game Freak says it 'might be a little difficult' to obtain
item.description: Game Freak has teased a brand new Mega-Evolved Pokémon ahead of the release of Pokémon Legends: Z-A's Mega Dimension expansion, but warns they might be a bit of a challenge to obtain.

item.title: Sisterhood of the Best Travel Pants: Best Travel Trousers (2025)
item.description: Travel pants that are tough enough to handle hangry moods and unplanned delays.

item.title: The FCC wants to roll back steps meant to stop a repeat of a massive telecom hack
item.description: After one of the biggest telecom hacks in US history, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) moved to enforce strict standards on carriers' cybersecurity measures. On Thursday, the agency is set to vote to roll back those requirements, arguing they were an unnecessary overstep of its authority. The China-linked Salt Typhoon hack revealed last year impacted […]...

item.title: 287 € pour marcher en travaillant : pourquoi le Walkingpad Z1 vaut le coup
item.description: Rester assis huit heures par jour, c'est fini. Amazon propose une réduction solide sur le Walkingpad Z1, un tapis compact capable de se faire oublier une fois votre session terminée.

item.title: ‘Hawk Tuah’ Girl Added to Lawsuit Over Alleged Crypto Memecoin Fraud
item.description: The suit claims that the HAWK coin was rigged from the start to inflate its value rapidly before crashing.

item.title: Trump administration wants to use federal power to challenge state AI laws
item.description: States trying to regulate AI could be overruled by Trump’s federal task force.

C'est donc le bon moment pour faire une excellente affaire sur votre prochain smartphone, tablette, PC portable, TV, etc. Vous retrouverez les meilleures offres Tech en temps réel dans cet article. ...

item.title: Les jouets dotés de l’IA déconseillés par des associations de défense des enfants
item.description: Ils sont mignons, voire câlins, et promettent d’apprendre et de tenir compagnie, mais les jouets dotés d’intelligence artificielle ne sont pas sans danger pour les enfants, selon des associations de défense des enfants et des consommateurs qui exhortent les parents à ne pas les acheter pendant les fêtes de fin d’année.

item.title: Sortera is turning America’s scrap aluminum problem into cash
item.description: Sortera has developed an AI-guided system to sort scrap aluminum by specific grades. The startup is building a second sorting facility in Tennessee.

item.title: Camera support could be the boost Matter needs
item.description: It's finally happening. Three years after Matter launched, the interoperability standard now includes the most popular smart home devices: cameras. The Matter 1.5 spec, announced today, adds support for all types of video cameras - from indoor and outdoor, wired and battery-powered cameras, to video doorbells, baby monitors, pet cams, and more. Matter support should […]...

item.title: How ‘good enough’ products are disrupting premium pricing
item.description: In a world where technology makes everything easier and cheaper, competitive advantage increasingly comes from business model innovation rather than product superiority. Strategy textbooks taught us that sustainable competitive advantage that commanded premium prices was best protected by powerful barriers to entry. Build a moat, create switching costs, leverage access to high costs of entry, own distribution channels, and it would be difficult for startups to compete for your markets. But the forces of disruption operate by different rules, systematically destroying the very foundations of pr...

item.title: Timothée Chalamet’s best role yet is your weirdly intense coworker on Zoom
item.description: A24 is promoting its new film ‘Marty Supreme’ with an awkward video call. Here’s why it’s genius. Timothée Chalamet just posted an 18-minute-long video to his Instagram to promote his upcoming A24 film, Marty Supreme. It might be his best role yet.

item.title: Dr. Martens just made the classic rain boot a whole lot more punk
item.description: Walks like a rain boot, talks like a punk fan. Here’s the thing about Wellington boots: They’re great when it’s raining, because they keep your toes dry and toasty. But when the rain stops, you feel a little silly stomping around in heavy rubber boots.

item.title: New York’s ubiquitous construction scaffolding gets a glow up
item.description: Six new designs remake the utilitarian construction shed into something near beautiful. New York City scaffolding is so commonplace it has become a kind of extra architectural skin covering the city. It’s estimated that there are more than 9,000 of these “construction sheds” (another term for scaffolding) installed across the city, enough to stretch nearly 400 miles if they were put end to end. ...
